text: A massive crowd, it could be a sports stadium, a u2 farew show or new year's eve on copacabana beach, but whatever is there are thousands and thousands of us. A mexican wav erupts success, celebration, with so many involved it's impossible to pick out anyone individually. Critical mass cyclists, easter crowds at st. Peter's basilica, nyc marathon, 4,000 flash mobbers doing the silent disco at london's victoria station, india's kumbh mela, macy's thanksgiving day parade, raves, subway parties, the dayto 500. . . . Gradually the screen splits into 2, and then 3 though at times there appears to be no division at all. EXT. FREEWAY. NIGHT. An overhead shot of a crammed freeway gives way to a sing vehicle, a 98 Toyota Tacoma, red and white with a topper.
Cut inside as Aron Ralston, 27 cuts off the freeway.

head_text.subj: OPENING TITLES ARE A SERIES OF TRIPTYCHS FEATURING ALL TH
TITLE CARDS EXCEPT THE MAIN ONE. THEY BLEND, OVERLAP AND
ADVERTS SOME FROM THE BILLBOARDS ARON'S VAN
PASSES, SOME FROM TELEVISION AND SOME FROM THE RADIO. AND

text: 'Utah. The Canyonlands. The slickrock desert. The red dus and the burnt cliffs and the lonely sky-all that which li beyond the end of the roads.' Edward Abbey. Desert Solitaire.

Eventually Aron's truck is now alone on an interstate roa 2. INT. ARON'S TRUCK. NIGHT. At the southwest edge of Green River, Aron Ralston drives under the interstate into a landscape of obscurity. He lo to his right and left, not a single light perforates the absolute blackness of the San Rafael Desert.
From high above, three quarters of the screen is black an see his truck's lights running parallel with the blacknes

A sign flashes by: Next Service: 110 miles America's challengers for the Tour de France flash by in pack of 15 or so neon spirits. Night training. 10PM. A BLM sign indicates that Horseshoe Canyon Trailhead is 4 miles ahead through the desert darkness.
From even higher above again we see him turn left into th black void.
Bang inside the truck now on a dirt road. Music at ear bl level. A yellow triangular sign cautioning ROADS MAY BE IMPASSAB DUE TO STORMS flashes past.
Jackrabbits dart onto the road, racing him, darting left right as he chases them down. They finish the game dartin back into the darkness.

Slowly, images from the Great Gallery materialise on different parts of the Triptych - petroglyphs and pictographs; dozens of 8-10 ft high Superhumans hovering groups of indistinct animals, dominating beasts and onloo alike with their long, dark bodies, broad shoulders, and haunting eyes.
Billboards, TV, cinema, www: commercial America sells everything to us through every means. As many brand names we can get.

Rushing across the desert grooves, pulling, snatching, ha left and right, the rear of the truck fishtails madly. Curves, swoops and sandy washes kick up dust clouds as everything in the truck flies all over the place. Except bike, locked down and braced solid. Music blazes on. Another Rabbit. Another fence line. Another curve.
Suddenly a small brown sign flashes past. He kicks down o the brakes and reverses back. It's the sign pointing out road spur to Horseshoe and Blue John Canyons.
Nearly missed it!
The truck turns sharp left.
Now a really bumpy road approaching the dirt parking area
Ghostly, but there are three other vehicles and two encampments at the Trailhead, despite signs prohibiting camping.

He turns off the music and waits for a head to pop out or light to come on but they have all turned in. Ghostly. He glides to a flat spot near the sign board welcoming visitors to the Horseshoe Canyon quadrant of Canyonlands National Park. He whips into the back of the truck and flings everything of the way of his sleeping bag and pad. Black. END OF TRIPTYCH TITLE SEQUENCE.
But no rest.
The doors smash open to reveal a glorious day and Aron's bike careers into it.

It's still like a wild road movie, but now on a bicycle. Having parked his motorized transport he ploughs into the land like an ad for extreme sports. Past bikers, he vanis temporarily in their dust cloud, he wears a bandana acros his face as the bikers pass by... a final telephone box, remnants of those who tried to settle or work this unforgiving land; Aborigines, frontier settlers, ranchers all driven away from a heartland he ploughs into.......

EXT. DESERT. CU on ARON. Wearing a pair of beat-up running shoes and thick wool-bl socks, Lycra biking shorts and a Phish tee shirt he has a back pack with equipment but hydrates through a gallon of water stored in an insulated three litre CamelBak hydrati pouch which he sucks on without stopping.

His bike pummels the canyon landscape and you get a sense the exhilaration this man gets from pitting himself alone against what nature can offer. He's clearly a fit and dar young man and these are his kicks.

Even uphill he hammers his way up the sandstone. Gasping oxygen, his legs screaming for rest, he pushes and pushes until the crest and then down, down, instant speed and he suck on his water again. Part of a massive clan who defin themselves not by what they are, but by what they do. In way, he's an action movie personified and the opening sho be shot and cut to provide adrenaline in spadefuls. Until...

Suddenly, he hits a sand trap and hurtles forward over th handle bars, face first into the sand, his toe clips and momentum brings the bike with him. The bike has him trapp on the desert floor like a takedown in wrestling. He subm landing nose deep in the sand. He sits up, looks around quickly to see if anyone saw. Pulls out his camera from h bag and takes a a self-portrait snap of the mess.
At what seems like the only tree for miles he U-locks his bike in the shade, pockets the keys, scoffs a muffin and heads off into the desert.
He approaches the crest of a sand gulley and sees below h just 30 yards down the canyon, 2 fellow hikers. He looks around. All of them in the middle of nowhere it seems.

location: APPROACH TO BLUE JOHN CANYON. DAY.

text: He can see now it's 2 girls passing a map back and forth between them. He rushes towards them, initially above the he walks along side. They're aware of him before he arriv
Hey. Are you doing the east pike? Can I come along with you for a while? The girls don't reply, just look at each other.
I'm on my own. I'm Aron.

location: APPROACH TO BLUE JOHN CANYON. DAY. A VAST ARROYO.

text: He slides/surfs down so he's on the same level as them, arriving in a haze of dust, holding out his hand for the shake. Big smile.
(looking at Megan) Sure, I'm Kristi.
Megan.
Nice to meet you. What a day.
It's beautiful.
Did you bike or come straight from the trail head?
We left the car there. Pretty quiet.
I left mine at the Horseshoe Canyon and biked here. 7.
You biked from Horseshoe? That's 20 miles or more.
17 and windy. The girls exchange glances.
I do this a lot. They laugh. He's crazy, but harmless.
Wasn't expecting to see anyone in the canyon today.
Yeah, you surprised us, sneaking up like that.
Sorry.
It's kind of nervy seeing a lone guy walking up to you in the middle of the desert.
Yeah, I know, I mean there's no one around for 50 miles.
... and suddenly there's a guy right behind you and `wait a minute, why is he wearing a HOCKEY
They all laugh.
Let me guess... You're here for the paintings or the Cathedral?
The Cathedral? We've got a bit disorientated and the map isn't great. Where is it?
The climb's a little tricky but it's worth it.
We climb. 8. They all laugh.

head_text.subj: INT. CAVE. APPARENTLY SMOOTH DOME. DAY

text: Towards us comes Aron, upside down, like a tiny, fast spi talking all the time, his voice echoing.

There's thousands of holds but you can't see them until you're almost upside down and then they just keep appearing... it's a bit of a act of faith so I'll go first... take off as much as you dare as there's a bit of a surprise at the other end...
You behave Aron Ralston or we'll tell your mother all about where you lure girls...

I swear I won't look but I swear you won't care when you get out here... We've been moving towards him as he rushes towards us, sp style. He's stripped to his underwear. He's lithe to say the least. We can't see the girls or what's underneath us but there's a feeling of the vertiginous, as much from th weird echo and the sense of reflected light as from the s of the dome.
... and the thing is, when you get to the middle... He lets go.
... there aren't any more. We spin and watch him fall into the most exquisite emeral pool 60 feet below.
They can't see him. They can only hear the explosive crac of man on water. 9.
Are you ok? ARON!
Of course he's ok. Listen to him. Aron fills the cathedral dome with his version of a Phish song at the top of his voice. Kristi strips to her underw and traverses away from Megan.
Got to be there, Meg.

From the pool below with Aron we see Kristi in her underw heading out arachnid-style to the centre. Before she gets there Megan appears too. She's left everything on except shoes. They crash into the pool one after the other. They bob together in the centre, the light seems to come from bene them and ripple over the heavenly ceiling.
We've got to go again. And film it!
Eating and drying in the powerful afternoon sun. A little self consciousness has returned but it's sweet-natured an fun still.....
I really can't eat all this chocolate by myself... Never mind, yes I can!
So have you got a girlfriend, Aron?
Well, there's not really anyone special.
Ah, so there's lots of girlfriends.
There's always a girl, you just don't know it yet. 10.
Yeah, we meet lots of guys and there's always a girl.
Long story.
With lots of characters in it.
Aron on top of a snowy peak. Self shot. Classic pose. Breathtaking backdrop.
I've done 46 of the 59 winter solo ascents.
Wow, highest person in Colorado.
Well I figure no one else is mad enough to climb in the winter.
... you can be the highest person on the continent!
Megan shows the image to Aron.
Didn't you see it?
What? No.
Yeah, it's an old cattle guardian's house - the roof's caved in and someone spray-painted MOTEL 6 on the side. Smelled weird though.
Just like a MOTEL 6 then?
Why are you on your own?
Solitude. Great tunes. Empty mind. He indicates the wilderness.
And I can sing Phish songs as loud as I like.
Phish?
Not those guys from...
Yeah, I know, I know.
See, that's why I'm on my own. Nobody likes me or my band. They laugh as he goofs for them. He gathers all their packaging and stuffs it in his backpack.
I'll get this. Leave no trace.
They're walking again.
Hey, but I like a beer like the next man. You know, end of the day.
They're negotiating a steep gulley. Aron is 1/2 way down, Megan at the top, Kristi on her way down to him.
I'm not certified yet but that's what I want to do.
An illegal instructor. 12.
It's hard to get the hours to qualify. Catch 22.
Well, we'll sign your time-card today.
Great. Now put your ass on my head.
Okay but don't look and no grabbing now, if I do...
Oh whatever, you love it.
Shhh! Aron then quickly slips to the bottom. Megan is way high, Kristi half way.

(at his most instructor- ish, talking all the time as he makes his way down) You'll have to chimney down a little ways - like here, watch - one foot on each wall then squat onto your right heel, now your butt's on the wall, so you can move your right foot across, now put your left foot under your butt lower down and scootch your butt down - watch that black part, it's slick, slime, try not to get it on your shoes - if you can get to these bomber handholds here it's like an elevator shaft and just think friction to control the slide. This is a keeper so always have someone at the bottom to boost you out. He looks up to them.
I didn't understand any of that.

location: CONJUNCTION OF BLUE JOHN CANYON, WEST FORK, EAST FOR

text: They come to a clear fork in the paths. He watches them t their map round and round. 13.
Kristi, I think this is our way back.
Why don't you come with me to the Big Drop Rappel? I can give you a lift back to your car.
How far is it? He shows them on the map.
About another 8 miles or so, I think.
You'll never get out before dark.
No, I really got to do this. Anyway I've my miner's lamp.
You don't climb at night, do you?
No, it's great for seeing snakes in hand holds. Can I get a picture then? They pose with raven feathers in their hair.
Listen, my friends are having a party tomorrow night. You should come.
Yeah, we'd like that. What time?
Where?

Drive on the east road and about 40 miles out there's a huge inflatable Scooby Doo. You can't miss it. Turn off and it's about 2 miles down that track. Starts late and it'll go right thru. Lots of cheek kissing and his last picture of them... 14.
Come on Aron, hike out with us - we'll go get your truck, hang out and have a beer.
No, I really got to do this.
Okay. Scooby Doo, yeah?
That's the one. I'll have 3 cold beers waiting for us.
12 cold beers!

And they separate down 2 different canyons shouting to ea other...'hot dogs!...'vegetarian hot dogs!'.... 'so that' cold beers and 9 vegetarian hotdogs!'...'.. I really can' eat all these vegetarian hotdogs by myself... never mind, I can!'... the last of the dialogue fading away as they l earshot of each other and we pull up out high over the meandering slits of sandstone...
Aron alone ... they are gone ... he picks up the pace as checks his watch... he loved them but now he's behind schedule and he's ruthless about his schedule...

location: HIGH ABOVE ARON. BLUE JOHN CANYON. DAY.

text: His sense of momentum is established again and it's clear he's moving downhill, into the fissure of the rock.

Without warning his feet suddenly slide forward from unde him and he skates/snap-kicks trying to keep his balance o floor of scattering pebbles left there by a flood. There' flash of the sky and dazzling sunlight. 15. Only his arms and the proximity now of the walls prevent landing hard on his ass.
A small snake slithers away from his giant feet.

Easy Aron, easy now. He keeps moving, descending still, but a little more circumspect. He lets the change of pace allow him to whip round his pack and with the practice of thousands of time selects and plays a CD without stopping, slipping the headphones over his head.
We see the CD begin to spin: the display tells us there's 38:47 to play before 0:01 appears.

Suddenly, louder than loud, the sound of fanatical 5,000 strong applause at the Phish live concert in Las Vegas, f his head and ours. He's heard it many times as he alternatively anticipates/answers all the dialogue preamble mixed over applause...
Good evening Las Vegas... are you having a good time? Are you ready for PHISH! Whether we are or not, the first song begins on a wave of adoration from his fellow Phish fans. He sings along.

location: BLUE JOHN CANYON. SHORT SLOT ENTRY. DAY.

text: Aron keeps descending, the canyon walls growing taller an closer, into the narrowing slot canyon.

location: BLUE JOHN CANYON. S-SHAPED LOG. DAY.

text: A dry waterfall, many months since it's seen rain. A drop maybe 12/15 ft with no obvious climb down. Way beyond his reach and jammed into the walls of the canyon is an enorm S-shaped log, sand bleached and wind dried it looks like massive reptile making its way down the canyon. Beyond it Aron can see his route down disappearing into narrowing darkness.
To reduce the drop he scrambles down clinging to the edge pushes away and drops the final 6 feet or so landing in a fine cloud of sand. Nothing to it, second nature.
He snaps the log now arching above him well out of reach. TITLE. " 2:41pm. Sat April 26th. 2003 "
Won't be coming back this way.

He spins and continues, seeing the first huge chockstones the size of vans, their noses buried in the floor of the canyon like unexploded bombs. He easily scrambles over on and around another-tight fit but he's skinny.
The slot is now just 4ft wide and as he stops to look at massive tree logs jammed at strange angles high above him silhouetted against the blue cloudless sky, he drinks dee from his water bottle.

On we go and so does the concert. He pumps the air unawar as we track above him - it's like the canyon in Star Wars he's Anakin feeling the force. One set of chockstones lea to another and he rapidly negotiates them like an obstacl race - until there's one the size of a big refrigerator w has been stopped by the walls 18 inches from the floor.

Over or under? He drops to his belly and squeezes underneath, rucking the sandy floor in front of him. He's halfway, his chest rising out the far side when suddenly can't move. The music jams and loops on 2 notes like bad techno. He pushes but nothing. He reaches back with his hand and releases a part of his rucksack strap that's snagged. And the music releases too He squat-jumps out and brushes off the sand. No panic -a nothing moment.
Now it's steeper. We're already 60ft below ground level a it's falling away further in front of us. Another drink a the map is out.

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. SILHOUETTE PROFILE. CROSS SECTION OF CANYON. DAY

text: We see a section of the canyon and the tiny figure of Aro moving within it. We track in and elide into a graphic vi of him chimneying his way along the canyon now only 3 ft at most. It's a chance to see his skill and thirst for climbing. And to see how deep he's going. 18. He uses his legs, back and natural body weight to body wa along and down the towering walls.

He's moving towards a final chockstone below him jammed i the gap. You can see the way he's thinking: it's about th size of a bus wheel and used as a platform will help him reduce the 10 foot drop and get quickly down into the nex section.
He reaches it at the same time we do and kicks fiercely, automatically, to make sure it's solid.
Yep. And across he steps onto it. It holds.

location: CANYON FROM UNDERNEATH SILHOUETTED AGAINST SKY. DAY.

text: As before he squats and clambers down the back side of th stone to reduce his drop down.

location: CANYON. DAY. C/U TIGHT ON ARON.

text: Just as he dangles there's a scraping sound, small but cl too close and the stone judders towards him, pulled by th torque of his weight on his side, rotating. Instantly and instinctively he lets go and drops. Like he trying to detach a mine dragging him to the sea floor.
But it follows him down, somehow he's released its latent energy.
He watches the chockstone follow him - not looking where going.
The backlit chockstone falling towards him consuming the

His arms rise to protect his head but his eyes remain ope and through his fingers we see the next 3 seconds. The ro face and his. It grabs his left hand and flings it against the left wal He pulls it away as the rock ricochets against the canyon careers towards his right arm which he raises, to compens for withdrawing the left, and to protect his head. The rock smashes the right hand and wrist against the wal and drags it down the remaining distance. Like a cheese grater it tears the skin from the back of the hand and th forearm, decorating the wall. Aron is powerless to stop i force and he lands on his feet allowing the rock to jam i front of him with his hand held against the canyon wall b the stone. All this happens too quickly. We can hardly register what happened as everything stops.
Silence. He's standing behind the rock. Like he's in a li for a bus. Like he's shaking someone's hand. A hand shake with the canyon. Silence.
Adrenaline, searing, roaring pain and panic.
FUCK, get your hand out of there! Pulls and pulls, yanks until his shoulder will dislocate, nothing moves. Sweat, anxiety flaring, hot pain.

Pushing with his left hand desperate to reverse the actio so simple to undo the moment, to reverse gravity for a sp second and pull his hand out... nothing. Again and again thrusting up with knees, thighs, pelvis, left arm, head, neck... nothing.
Then slam upwards, harder than ever as though he's run at from a hundred yards and it's a door that will surely bur open.
Air exploding out of his lungs. And then a quiet hollow sound of the boulder shifting fractionally. A howl of phenomenal pain -

He reverses the fraction and collapses in sweat and blood knees bleeding, good fingers lacerated. But he remains upright, attached. Unable to physically collapse. Grabs his shirt and wipes sweat away and goes to drink. H hula-hoops out of his backpack to get access to the water gulps down 3 full throatfulls - stops mid 4th and backwas as much as he can into the bottle -
No, no... more water. He caps the lid tightly and drops it into his pack.
Relax. Stop. Come on. He breathes and breathes, taking stock for the 1st time.
Time Check. 3.14pm. Stares at it until it changes to 3.15 - the watch is working.

He examines the boulder at each point he can reach, stretching and contorting to see into his crushed and wretched hand where his thumb is visible above and his li finger below. No matter how much he touches them, there i no feeling. He prods up and down to see what feeling is l and where it stops. Comparing left hand to where the righ hand is trapped to measure the width of his right wrist - smaller than the width of his little finger on his right hand. He can barely get the little finger of his left han the gap. We reverse back on him at each contortion. He

FUCK! What the fuck? How the fuck did you get your hand trapped by a fucking boulder? Its crushed, it's fucking dying man! He reaches up and touches the trail of blood, hair and sk left on the canyon wall as the rock pushed him to where h is. Looks under boulder, no blood - check. [He hears the crowd cheering on his headphones. It's been playing throughout. He switches it off] He looks above for the first time.

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. PULL OUT OF CANYON. DAY.

text: ... to see the slot canyon, back and back and back, nothi more than a dry crack in the surface of this massive land Gradually his cries for help become inaudible.

He unpacks everything with great energy, like a stocktake and lays it all out on the surface of the rock; 22. chocolate bar wrappers and bakery bag with crumbs of chocolate muffin inside that he volunteered to take away behalf of the girls, 2 small bean burritos, cd player, cd extra AA batteries, mini digital video camcorder, small m use tool and 3 LED headlamp.

... of all these elements - these are now his only compan and their POV of him reflects that as he tests each one f its potential, opening all the blades and laying them out look at them; sunglasses - scratched, bike Ulok key, rock climbing harness, cloth goggles bag, rapelling equipment, water bottle, car keys, plastic grocery bag, empty de- hydration pack, money, credit cards, green and yellow climbing rope in black zippers bag, a stick, stones and s Everything. Pause. He stares at it all and it all stares back at him.
3.28, changes to 3.29

Inside the tiny gap we see... his headlamp flick on to le him assess the rock and the wall and his hand in between He picks a point and begins to chip away with the knife. He's back - energy, movement, purpose, action makes him happy. He occasionally stops to look at his left hand, swollen and puffy and constantly in need of flexing. He g into a rhythm of 'tick,tick,tick', flex and back again, `tick,tick,tick'
4.19pm, changes to 4.20
In a huge close up of this eye he can see in the foregrou that there's a pile of steel filings from the knife itsel almost as big as the dust from the ground -
Not good. He blows the whole lot into our face with a mighty gust.
When in a hole.... Alternative; he starts digging away at the wall instead, result.
Fuck. It's hard as iron. Pause. You're gonna have to cut your arm off. As if to answer that idea we...

Tapping a rock in his hand onto the top of the knife as h balances it against the wall or with his mouth. Weird clo angles as he almost taps the side of his eye socket. Suddenly, he hammers down with ten times more force onto handle of the knife, the rock explodes in his hand, showe pick dust over everything, and bouncing the knife off the rock. Once again, gravity takes over. The knife hits his shorts and as he moves to grab it, he misses it and knock further round the back of his leg. He pivots and turns to and catch it but gravity is quicker than his restricted t and it falls into a hole between the rounded rocks near h left foot -
The knife is visible in the crack below and behind his ri leg but he can't twist to get anywhere near it. He tries pull the canyon wall off balance to get closer. No chance 24.
Shit! He pulls off his right sock and shoe and tries to squeeze foot into the hole. Too big. Size 10. He looks upward. He can't believe he's done it.
Shit!!!

We're on a level with the knife in the little hole beneat his feet. An enormous overhead light switches on (Aron's headlamp placed above to let him see). The stick enters f top of screen and nudges the knife in a semi circle. It's bit Punch and Judy if it wasn't so fucking serious. Huge shadows. No success. The knife remains where it is. Maybe ant races across it. Pause. The stick withdraws.
The stick re-enters with the top of it almost broken off, acting like a hook, we push in on the knife as the stick hooks through the little ring at the end of the knife. It lifts.

Looking down onto the ground, around his leg, his toes holding the stick like a chopstick lift the knife out and tremulously, breathlessly, towards his good arm. He picks off the stick gently. Big smile. First one.
Sweet.

We pass through the transparent title on our way along th canyon. Half dark. We're on a wind blowing dust through t canyon walls, to find a miner in the distance digging int the rock. It's Aron of course, and his head-lamp is fille with the dust swirling through. He's using the shorter fi from the multi tool and has tied a shoe lace to his wrist looped through the ring at the end of the tool. He pulls cap down, to keep most of the dust out of his eyes. His l are caked but he keeps blowing on his arm, to keep it cle
The watch, now luminous, changes to 00.00.
Midnight is celebrated with a tiny, careful, sip of the water. He holds it in his mouth. Puffing his cheeks, circulating the precious fluid around.

Daylight, a lunar landscape almost, though with patches o green and giant boulders, Aron whom we sense only by bein around his shoulder is out walking with his friend, Mark Eeckhout through this field of boulders. They come upon o the size of a house buried nose deep in the field.
Wow, look at the size of this one. There's no cliffs or mountains anywhere near. We look at Mark's pleasant, unremarkable face for far too long as he looks around -
How the fuck did this get there? It's like we're on the moon looking over Buzz Aldrin's shoulder at Neil Armstrong; it certainly sounds like that

Chip,chip,chip; stretches his arm, flexes his legs, tick,tick,tick. He changes the blade, prising suddenly at section of the rock with his file. It bites and a dime si shred chip of rock arcs through the night light. He catch it perfectly on his right elbow.
Cool. He picks it off his arm and places it on top of the rock to where he's working. It's a grain of sand on the seasho but it's something. Boy, his arm and his legs are aching now.

location: ABOVE ARON, LOOKING DOWN INTO CANYON. NIGHT.

text: He's stepped into his harness and is throwing 30ft of rop towards us. There's a tangle of knots and carabiners look for purchase close to camera. Each time it falls back all the way. He persists, each time, varying his line of atta fractionally. Finally it catches. He pulls gently at first, then fiercely, it holds and we slide softly and slowly down the rope and as we reach him gently takes the weight off his feet finally.
Aahhhhh. Lovely relief for him, light off, his eyes close.

A re-run of the accident. He can now witness it in detail though it were planned and his role is to point us where look. 3 seconds become 30... We fall with his face in hig definition slow motion watching his future. We fall with rock pitilessly chasing him down to the floor of the cany As he lands...
... His eyes open and he stands unsteadily rubbing at his legs, the lack of circulation has forced him up. Doesn't think about the dream, starts chipping again.
Lit only by his lamp, the black shifts to grey and then there's light. He watches it arrive. A rush of wind. Something flaps and he looks up sharply -
Caw-caw.
A black raven flies symmetrically the length of the canyo slit above him. Blue, blue sky.
Caw-caw. As he stretches his neck to follow the path of the only o living thing, he freezes stock still. The bird has gone. Nothing moves. Not him.... nothing. Time passes. He switches his light off.

head_text.subj: EXT. NEVADA DESERT. BLACK ROCK CITY. PRE DAWN.

text: On top of some 4 x 4 vehicles are 8-10 ft huge Easter Isl like masks, multi-coloured. Multiple bikes are strapped t the backs of the vehicles too. More of Aron's friends, including Mark V.E. mill around their 4 x 4s. There are multiple lights in the distance but it's unclear what it might be. The vehicles' own headlights illuminate Rana, a stunningly beautiful red-haired woman in her mid-20s, effortlessly organising the 15 or so group. As before, we remain behind Aron. By the camera's virtually complete concentration on Rana it's clear he's a fan. 28.
OK - lights off and line up alongside me. They turn off their vehicles' headlights as she draws a l line in the sand and they join her standing on one side o it.

On the other side of this line, everything will be different. As they all hold hands and together step cross the line (Aron's keen and ever so slightly ahead of everyone acros the line) the sparkling lights of the crescent-shaped `to of vehicles and camps that is Burning Man are replaced by astonishing sunrise in the Nevada desert. They hoot and holler as Rana smiles beautifully at Aron.
And remember, stick together, the desert wants to kill you.
Aron is very still, looking at the rock and the open blad lying on top of it. Suddenly he looks over his shoulder t see...
A dagger of sunlight appear behind him. His won sunrise. C.U. WATCH. 9.30am

He looks at ithe sunbeam as though it's his prey and it m run away. It makes it's way along the canyon walls toward him. He's very still. But it shifts across the floor and it's going to miss him. He whips off his left shoe and so and pushes it towards the coming light. Slowly it climbs caresses his ankle and lower calf. He pulls the other soc off and alternates the feet. He looks like he's doing yog As it leaves him passing overhead it suddenly bursts into opening in front of him. 29. It's a beautiful sight as the colors of the canyon reawak but we can see from above that he appears to be behind a with a room of life beyond him.

It's three-oh-five on Sunday. This marks my twenty-four-hour mark of being stuck in Blue John Canyon above the Big Drop. My name is Aron Ralston. My parents are Donna and Larry Ralston of Englewood, Colorado. Whoever finds this, please make an attempt to get this to them. Be sure of it. I would appreciate it. He takes long blinks and seems to avoid looking at himsel though the screen is facing him. He looks alarmed and wid eyed, startled, in contrast to his slow slurred delivery.

So... I was hiking Blue John Canyon yesterday... and this happened. He pulls the camera round to show where his forearm and w disappear into the horrifyingly skinny gap between the chockstone and the wall. As he does that we
Flashes of the accident-almost in silhouette - like an animatic side view. It freezes just before the moment of entombment.
What you're looking at there is my arm, going into the rock... and there it is, stuck. It's been without circulation for 24 hours.
It's pretty well gone. If the colour doesn't come across on the video, it's grey and blue.
Unnhhhhh.......I'm in deep stuff.
So I have very little water. He can't help look in the camera towards those who know w that means in this place.
Yeah, I have about a third of a litre left. He picks up the water bottle and shakes it for the camera
Different angle on the freeze-frame.

So the way I see it... there's kind of four things happening here... I tried to move it with some rigging... useless... and I tried chipping away at the rock... I think part of the problem is, is that my hand is actually supporting the rock. Which means every time I chip away the rock moves a bit and settles onto my hand again. I can't feel it happening but microscopically, it seems to be, because the little gap over there between the rock and the wall seems to be getting smaller. And this chockstone is the hardest thing here.
A breeze slides through the canyon and he shudders involuntarily for five seconds.
So the third thing left was to cut my arm off.

I don't know whether I could do that but it's pretty much suicide. It's four hours to my vehicle that way and with very difficult climbing with one hand and the bike is like two, two and a half hours, that way but the climbing... fourth class climbing... which I think will be probably impossible with one hand... between the blood loss and the dehydration I think I would die if I cut off my arm.
Which means I'm waiting for someone to come along. He summons up the guts to let the evidence out.
I didn't tell anyone where I was going and I didn't leave a note on the truck.
Dumb. The video whirrs on until he suddenly looks straight into lens.
He hears voices. 32.
We see his reaction to this sound through the video messa
He puts the camera down and listens. People descending at the S log! He can hear them. He screams and screams and screams and then he stops. He listens again.
The noise is there still. Again he screams and screams.
Breathing hard, heart racing he listens again. The noise still there unchanged. He knows now it's not people. They would have heard him.
He looks above and behind and sees a kangaroo rat disappearing, scuffling, behind a chockstone.
He stops, staring at the camera still recording. He picks up, rewinds and ...
... re-runs the sound of him screaming for help. 33.
Freaky. We just see an arbitrary view of the rock and sky the video camera, maybe with a bit of elbow, but we hear desperation, screaming at no one, distorting on the tiny speaker.
He stops it. The sound of his absolute helplessness and n freaks him out and threatens absolute despair. Snorts.
No one's coming Aron. He rewinds to the end of the message and erases his futil calls for help.
Aron's Truck. We sense him in the cab but we're not insid with him yet. Music loud and pulsing as we travel towards the inflatable Scooby Doo. It's 12ft tall, powered by a m generator.
Aron swerves to affect the figure which buckles and flaps his after-draft.
We stay with the dancing figure as his truck drives away the landscape. The generator fan rattles on as the boomin bass of the truck fades.

You can see him thinking. Will the girls go to the party? 34. EXT. GOOGLE-EARTH SATELLITE SHOT OF WILDERNESS. DUSK. We're now high above the desert, and in the time-lapse we the soft, grey, endless line of darkness cross right to l
A flashing, strobe-ing light - Aron's head-lamp bouncing and forth off the canyon walls - but also, as he continue chip away...
...jump-cutting, strobe-lit as though by flash, of Aron m dressing for the night.
We see the thermometer on his watch falling down and down from 70 => below 50.

The whole thing is almost like stop-frame animation. He cannibalizes everything he can, using his knife, his teet he tears holes in a cloth camera bag, he's frantically pa to occupy himself, to pass time, to create heat from ener but he has to be careful not to stab himself in the eye. thrusts his left arm into the newly fashioned sleeve, pul it up with his teeth. Purple webbing around his right arm, the insulated Camelb protects his upper arm from the chilling canyon wall. Yel webbing wraps a grocery bag (that held the burritos) roun his upper right bicep. 35. The dirty green and yellow ropes are curled round his leg like pythons. Finally he puts his head inside the rope ba
It's plastic inside and although it's black the light fro his head-lamp suddenly lights him up alarmingly as we go inside with him.
He looks like a multi-coloured version of the Michelin Ma only much thinner.
He laughs, as though he can see how ludicrous he looks. We return to normal speed as he turns the light off.
BLACK - but we can hear his breathing close as in a space suit. LONG PAUSE.

God, I am praying to you for guidance. I'm trapped in Blue John Canyon - you probably know that - and I don't know what I am supposed to do. I've tried everything I can think of. I need some new ideas. Please show me a sign. PAUSE - Just his breath. He switches on the head lamp and the inside of the bag explodes with light. There's enough light for any kind of heaven but it's just Aron in Blue John Canyon. He looks around his bag. He stops. Silence. Only his breathing to listen to. Heart rate... fast... too fast. Light off. PAUSE. 36.

OK, then, God, since you're apparently busy: Devil, if you're listening, I need some help here. I'll trade you my arm, my soul, whatever you want. Just get me out of here. You want me never to climb again, I can give that up. Just show me the dotted line.
Ungg-gggu-ggga-gggngh! His throat uncontrollably shudders and splutters as his t rattle with cold suddenly. It does sound like a demonic f from the multi-coloured headless man.
Yeah. Not very funny.

Aron leaves work: at no point do we see Aron. He's there, you sense him in reflective surfaces, his arms, particula his right one and his feet occasionally come into shot. I not a strict P.O.V, more like 'over the shoulder' but wit much shoulder.
What you doin'?
Still not sure. I'll see you Tuesday.
Have a good one.
Always do.
11:59 => 00.00 in huge, luminous figures.

He pulls his bag off and pulls his water bottle out of th ground where he has half-buried it. It won't open. He can unscrew it. He mutters, cursing himself for tightening th lid too much. He puts it between his teeth and levers wit his head, but nothing. Is his strength vanishing so quick He looks at his puffy left hand... there's a tremble in i He shakes it to get rid of the tremble and jams the bottl between his legs. He uses a bit of cloth to give his hand better purchase on the top. We're tight on the neck of th bottle as it releases, finally and he lifts it, slowly, almost ceremonially. Controlling the tilt, a half-mouthfu of water slides onto his tongue. He tilts the bottle back towards upright but not the whole way. He waits. Circulat the splash of water around his mouth.
The bottle neck stares at Aron.
... his eyes staring at the bottle neck.

He still holds the water in his mouth as he rewinds the t onto the bottle and reburies it in the sand to stop any evaporation. He moves to pop his contact lenses into his mouth and wash them in the moisture. First one then the o as we...
The images shift with the lens change back to his apartme daylight, we sense him though he's probably in the shower His ansaphone clicks in. 38.
Aron, it's Mom. Hoping to catch you. Nothing urgent. Dad's in New York so it'll be a quiet weekend. Aron is clearly there but can't answer.
Call me. Lots of love.
In front of his bathroom mirror he's slipping his lenses for the day. It looks like The Man Who Fell To Earth.
Huge close-ups that freak people out who've never worn lenses. Mirror shots and lots of short soft focus.
We hear a girl and a guy somewhere in the apartment. He closes the door. GIRL SHOUTS:
That was your Mom! And your Dad called. Call him. We're going. See you next week. Oh, and Rana called.
He is absolutely still. Almost absent. Flies buzz around him. Indeterminate time passes.
Massive C/U of an ant. Huge, high-definition image, more like a JCB-digger than an insect, and then more of them, all moving towards the mosquitoes which hover and land ne the real giant, Aron.

He watches them devour him and then he clears them away f his hand. Suddenly breaks and he's busy now well before sunrise. In the grey-white, soft morning he is involved i recycling his overnight insulation gear into a crude lift pulley. Obsessive, inventive, analytical, he constantly adjusts a adds and subtracts, and cannibalizes. Undoing and tieing knots with his teeth and hand. Each time nothing happens the rock. But each time he doesn't stop. He tries again a again and again; looping and re-looping throwing and catc ropes; creating footholds and bouncing in them with his f his knees, his ass. Finally he stops. He looks down. For a moment it's as tho he will cry. He looks up to where he came from and

head_text.subj: INT/EXT. VARIOUS. CANYON AND BEYOND. DAY.

text: ... suddenly we're moving, retracing his journey at increasing and eventually staggering speed. Through the slot canyon, up and into the blazing light ac the desert paths, past his chained-up bicycle and back to truck waiting at the side of the road. But we don't stop.

We crash into the back of the truck and there, lying on i side is an almost-full bottle of Gatorade, and then there grapefruit, and another one, and they've got sparkly condensation on them -like advertising spritzer mist - al over them. And a water bottle, and an orange. And high energy snack bars and another orange. The fruit seems to roll around the empty truck. 40. The Gatorade lies on its side and the liquid slaps slowly backward and forward like a Lava lamp. The liquid literal bulges with wetness, moisture texture, and we...
... snap back to Aron's face.
Aron trying not to look at himself:
It's freaking me out looking at myself so I hope you guys OK with this
We can see 2 images of him when we go behind the balanced video on the rock, as he has deliberately turned the scre away from himself.
It's Monday - all day - bummer. I spent the morning trying to create a 6:1 system ration and lift the boulder but friction between the rope and carabiners is dissipating every bit of force I apply.
All it's good for is sitting in...
We see a more objective view of his morning's activities he describes them. We see him below us as the raven flies between us and him.
There's a raven flies overhead, I clocked it at 8.15. I'll bet it's there tomorrow too. I'll film it for you tomorrow
We see the raven and we see him check his watch. Sure enough, 8.14 Slides to 8.15.

I have about one hundred and fifty millilitres of water left. That's four ounces. I can't believe it but I peed twice today, within a few minutes of each other. How is this possible? It's two days since I peed, I'm dehydrated and I had to go so quickly I forgot to save the first. I saved the second in the CamelBak. Will I drink it? It smells foul, and hot but it'll settle. And I can chill it in the sand in the night. It's like Polar winter here for nine hours.
We see his precious bottle of water. It looks back at him Next to it is the Camelbak of his stored urine.

No number twos. Which will disappoint my insect friends. They're gonna have to wait. The sunlight appears down here for a few hours. I get 15 minutes of it at 9.35... and apart from chipping away uselessly at this rock that's pretty much my morning routine.

Aron is deathly still as we travel towards him with the dagger of light. His leg is stretched out and the only movement is the change of leg halfway through. He stays i shot throughout getting bigger and then smaller as the li approaches and recedes; the sliver of light leaves the canyon.

I keep chipping at the rock but just to generate warmth and give me something to do. I think it's making it worse. I know it's settling more on my arm as I remove material from it. The area where I chipped flakes off yesterday has already rotated down onto my arm. PAUSE. I can't feel anything. PAUSE. So I made a great tourniquet and I tried to cut it off.

We see him pull the elastic neoprene tubing insulation fr the CamelBak. It's stretchy, supple and strong and emerge like a thin snake. It's perfect. He wraps the black neoprene around his right forearm 2 inches below his elbo Simple overhand knot tightened with his teeth. 2nd knot, knot, clips the neoprene with a carabiner and twists 6 ti tight.
Now real pain in his right arm. Weird smile at the succes The skin colour separates; fish belly white below the tourniquet and bright red bunched up crushes of flesh bet the elbow and the tourniquet.

Oh yeah. That aches. He takes out the multi-tool and switches to the long blad looks at it. Then he presses the blade and draws it quick across his forearm. Nothing. Repeats it harder. Nothing. No cut, no blood, nothing. He switches to the short knife and saws viciously at the same point.
Shit! He releases the tourniquet and as the blood flow returns series of angry red lines establish themselves where he w sawing. He looks at them.
Pathetic, Aron, pathetic.

The blades are too blunt even to break the skin. I guess that's the chipping. It's not even a proper Leatherman. It's a knock-off one we got free in a gift pack with a torch... Mom gave it to me. LONG PAUSE. Sis. Sonja, I'm very proud of you.

I didn't get to hear firsthand how your championships went, but I heard from Mom that you placed very well at the national competitions, that you were tenth overall in speech and debate in the nation. Hot damn, girl. I'm very proud of you. Not just for that but for who you are. He looks directly in the lens for the first time.
I can imagine you in your living room looking back at me.
We see his sister on her living room sofa. The sofa sits the open section of the canyon.

I've been thinking about what my friend Rob in Aspen says to me several... frequently.. Several times that, confusingly, 'It's not what you do but who you are'. I kind of got hung up on that a lot, because I always thought who I was, was very much wrapped up with what I did. That I was happy because of the things that I did that made me happy. If things you do make you happy, then they can also make you unhappy. I think that's why I found myself being as ambitious and energetic - The wind interrupts him and he shivers.
(mutters, bitterly) It's cold... this place is an ice- box at night... And killing winds. 45.
(he struggles to complete the sense of the
" - to do all the outings that I did". PAUSE. As he loses track of what he's saying and then catches up the canyon has become noticeably darker. He's oblivious.

I did want to say, on the logistical side of things, I have some American Express insurance that should cover costs of the recovery operation when that does happen. Bank account balances should take care of my credit-card debts. You'll have to sell my house, Mom and Dad. Possession- wise, I don't know if Sonja can use my computer and video camera...
He's interrupted by a sudden realization as he looks firs one way up the canyon and then the other. He looks up at sky above.
There's an angry looking black motherfucker of a cloud.

A massive crack of noise like the land has split. His eye staring up, unblinking, the corridor of light above him reflected in is contact lenses like mirrors. Suddenly a d of water hits his eye like an invisible bomb dropping fro the sky.

We're many miles away, the dust spits as though hit by si bullet tracer fire. Raindrops gathering and multiplying, soaking and bouncing off the desert floor, they skim and into a groove and then another, the slit instantly fills water drops crash on the new surface. The spillage spread and fills everything near it. We tilt up, the sky is furi black, and murderous. Lightning arcs across hundreds of miles.

Aron's sky darkens above him. Instantly plunging him into dark, violet nether-light. He looks up the canyon as he pulls at his arm in panic and tries to gather his laid-ou possessions into his backpack. Simultaneously he opens hi mouth to gather any drops he can into his parched throat.
A channel fills now as the grooves spill and multiply. Th water poured from above appears everywhere, visibility is virtually gone, whether it's through mist or darkness it' impossible to tell.

Another channel explodes like a volcanic surging mass in every direction. The camera literally slips and slides as the water now seems to take a direction towards deeper gulleys, looking for something to fill, for somewhere to escape to. The floor of the desert becomes a river careering towards slot canyons.
Now carrying debris with it the water cascades into the natural pipe-work of the desert.

We see the S log from below as someone seems to pour unimaginable tons of water over the lips of the canyon ab it. The walls glisten with force as the canyon becomes a wall of churning mud, hurtling towards the chockstones. T smaller ones are picked up and tossed downstream, smashin and breaking on the bigger ones.
We can see Aron in the distance pulling at his arm. Witho time to watch it's journey towards him, it seems to skip and hit him like a tsunami under-surging the initial push water on the floor.

In an instant it smashes into his chest, scattering all o his possessions as he still tries to grab them. He pushes and pulls, trying to gain height but is underwa almost immediately. He tries to take a huge suck of air before he's submerged but even that is compromised by wat We hear him choke and he disappears into the liquid wall mud.

We're with him underwater. He's trying to switch his ligh on. We can see almost nothing in this washing machine of churning slush and debris and malevolent water. The light flicks on. He can see his arm and the rock. Suddenly the water lifts the chockstone and his arm releases. He pulls towards him, luminous deathly white in the mud, and flat, too big.
We're close on Aron's face, at last free but now suffocat in darkness.
Aron gasps and throws his night bag off his head and to t floor. He's sweating and gasping; thumped alert but...
... the canyon is dry as Mars. He tries to control his breathing. Head down, sweat drips onto his arm - he licks off and lifts his head - a sudden shiver - looks at his watch.
The display changes from 20.29 => 20.30
He can't believe so little time has passed. He's only jus closed his eyes. It's going to be a long night. The two bottles stand looking at him. He goes back in the head bag and we go with him.

He holds the video camera at waist height and switches it playback. He rewinds through his messages. Stops, switche off playback and rewinds the blue LCD screen to save batt The light is surreal, soft LCD hell.
Battery time. Time rewinding, hurtling backwards. 49. Stops. Plays back.

Megan and Kristi. The Cathedral. They clamber out in wet clothes - it's from after their first jumps. We see all three of them climb and fall and get out of the water and climb and fall, smashing into the azure water. Their face are dripping wet, beaming mad, screaming and howling, completely natural, children really, on their first helte skelter / Big Dipper. He rewinds this time in vision. Kristi's bra and pants ar soaking. Megan's top cascades water as she rises out of t water.
For Aron the volume of his and their shouting is deafenin and the first human sounds he has heard for days. He watches, staring, laughing; not laughing, staring, eyes tearing in self-pity.
There's water, joy, 2 beautiful girls, happiness, sensual company, freedom...
He looks at the picture and then into the bag. His breath is hard, pronounced. He carefully tells himself..
No. No. Don't. He sees the moisture on the inside of the bag, condensati He licks it with his sticky tongue, twice, three times. H looks back at the LCD screen.
The LCD looks back at him.
He kills the image and snaps it shut.
He emerges from the bag. 21.05 and looks at the bottle. He takes the Camelbak and saying...
See you later... ... swallows quickly 2 'spoons' of urine without disturbi the sediment. Tangy and bitter, the saltiness makes him wince.

We're in his truck again but this time over his shoulder we can see the Scooby Doo Figure dancing in the distance. It's now lit up too, as night is falling, and we're comin it from the other direction. As he gets to it he swerves follows its guide to the party.
Jump cut, pulling up at the party.

Jump cut, inside it's nice, full of ordinary decent peopl though no one acknowledges Aron as we stay attached to hi shoulder. There's a mini-Scooby Doo dancing in the main r and there's a light, early party atmosphere. Aron searche for the girls, approaching any cluster to see which girls they contain. Rana is there but doesn't acknowledge him. 51. There's no Megan or Kristi anywhere and we finally settle the bar / drinks table where there is an ocean of all kin of drink. And melting ice in huge buckets with bottles of beer floating around in them. And orange juice, and popsicles. And melon, and lemon and lime. And grapefruit and oranges for Margaritas are filling frosted glasses. During the ritual we...

Aron ducks out of his head-bag and shakes his water bottl Something he always does - to check the sound of real wat To make sure he hasn't drunk it all without knowing. He opens, tilts and holds as always and then ritualistically removes his contact lenses and washes them in his mouth. Suddenly a shiver tears across him like an attack dog. He coughs a lens out and as he tries to catch it before it g into the sand he tips the bottle in his lap. He hasn't put the top on fully. It goes horizontal on his shorts and a leak of the sacred fluid darkens his tan sho He whips it upright.

(furious at himself) Fuck a nut, Aron. Pay fucking attention - look what you did? He stares at the stain - with all the dirt on his shorts already paste. He screws the lid on slowly and can barely bothered to lift his lens into his mouth.
With difficulty he puts the murky lens back in his bloody eye.

The image shifts with the lens to night, everything short focus. Only one thing at a time clear, everything else diffuse. No idea where we are. We come over Aron's should and he's clearly in the deep background of a vehicle. In front of him a half a dozen of his friends (boys and girls)... and Rana, excitedly chatting. Though we can hea nothing. 52. Gradually it becomes clear it's night outside. They are a undressing in their seats until all are butt naked. The t (we can't hear) is clearly more infantile than sexual. We beginning to see there's a ferocious blizzard outside. An we appear to be badly exposed to it. Up a mountain, on th crest of a high road... Snow, hail, swirls savagely aroun all sides of the truck. We remain inside. It's warm, the heater blows. They prepare themselves for a mutual signal, press their window buttons. All the windows open and a BLIZZARD explo inside the vehicle.
One shot outside - POVs naked arms out the windows shakin and saluting the storm. Their crazy, happy faces through windscreen as the weather invades the vehicle.
Aron very still, listens to their screams. He looks at hi knife dangling from his wrist by the shoelace.

Hundreds of miles of canyon - sunrise. The inner canyons change from dark umbers and black shadows to immense band pastel yellow, white, green and a hundred shades of red, hallucinogenic movement towards light. V.O. `Good morning America!' etc. There's a chorus of 'Good Mornings' from American TV & ra shows. Literally dozens of them from Texas to Oregon, Massachusetts to the Carolinas.
Aron joins the morning chorus.

Good morning everyone! It's 6:45 Tuesday morning in BJ Canyon. The weather is great! I figure by now that Leona, my housemate - Hi Leona! - has missed me hopefully since I didn't show up last night. Another hour and a half they'll miss me for not showing up for work. Hi Brion at work! Best case scenario is they notify the police and after a 24 hour hold they file a report, a missing persons report. Which means noon tomorrow it's official that I'm gone. I do still have the tiniest bit of water left. Well, actually, I've resorted...I've had a couple pretty good gulps of urine that I saved in my Camelbak. I sorta let it distill...it tastes like hell. So it's 70 hours since I left on my bike from Horseshoe Trailhead during which time I have consumed 3 liters of water and a couple mouthfuls of piss. Pause. Did I say the weather is great? Well, it is. Though flash floods potential is still present. There's 4-prong major canyons upstream from me that all converge in this 3 foot wide gap where I am. The rock I pulled down on top of me, it was put there by flood.
Still, I'd get a drink. He shudders, it's ridiculous. Then composes himself during a long blink and looks strai at the camera.

Mom, Dad, I really love you guys. I wanted to take this time to say the times we've spent together have been awesome. I haven't appreciated you in my own heart the way I know I could. Mom, I love you. I wish I'd returned all of your calls, ever.
I really have lived this last year. I wish I had learned some lessons more astutely, more rapidly, than I did. I love you. I'll always be with you.
Switches off the camera. He charges into setting up the 6:1 haul system again. Muc quicker this time. He clears the rope - the rock - of his possessions and puts his sunglasses on.
Ready for lift-off. He bounces his full weight in the stirrups and pulls on t haul line. It looks a better set up.
Come on, move, dammit. Nothing. He stops. And stares directly at the knife below him. Absolute stillness. Nothing moves. Not him. Not even the insects.
The knife stares back.

Without warning he suddenly tourniquets his arm again . T around the fore arm, knotted twice and clipped with a carabiner that he twists 6 times. He secures the fix by attaching the purple webbing. Looks to his watch

He folds open the knife, grasps it in his fist and pickin spot just above the rock's grip on his right wrist, he hesitates and then violently plunges the blade into his a up to the hilt. He lets go leaving the knife embedded. He swoons and star at it. He slowly grasps the tool more firmly and wriggles slightly, the blade connects with something hard. He taps knife down and feels it knocking on the radius of his upp forearm bone. He puts his ear close and we can hear the little thocking sound.
Whoa, that's the bone. He pulls the knife out opening the wound more. There's ba any blood. He pokes at the gash with the tool.

Ouch! He can see the epidermis, thick and leathery rough. Yello fatty tissue under the skin in a membrane layer around th muscle. He thocks, thocks again and some blood finally se out and blocks his view. He pulls the knife out and think He's sweating and puts the tool on top of the chockstone. He immediately pulls up his water bottle and stares into With a little shake he opens it and drinks it all gulping open throated. He shakes any last drop down and runs his tongue up into the neck. He screws the lid back on and loosens the tourniquet. There's no discernible increase i blood loss. He picks up the video again.

This next part may not be for all viewers at home. It's a little after eight. At precisely eight o'clock I took my last sip of clean water... and... hide your eyes, Mom... He pans across the boulder and zooms in on the wound, smattered with bright red blood. 56.

I made an attempt - a short career in surgery, as it turned out - those knives are just not anywhere close to the task. I've got about an inch-wide gash in my arm that goes about a half inch deep. I cut down through the skin and the fatty tissue, and through some of the muscle. I think I cut a tendon, but I'm not sure. I'll never saw through the bones with this knife. I tried, anyways. It really just didn't go well. The tourniquet is relaxed at this point. Which actually is a little bothersome, considering I'm not bleeding that bad, barely at all. It's so weird. You'd expect to definitely see more pulsing and bleeding, but oh well.
I'm really fucked now. I'm out of water.

Stops the video and rips a section of his t-shirt to make impromptu bandage to cover the wound. As he ties it with teeth there's a rush of someone else's noise: the swat of wings. He grabs the camera just in time to catch the very of the raven's flight 70 ft above his head.
Shit missed it. 8:31AM. He's late and I still missed it. We can hear his heart racing. He holds his left hand to i hoping to calm it down.
Like the beginning there are thousands of fans filling th screen, people everywhere, maybe holding lighters. And ag like the beginning the screen splits into 2... 57.

The rest of Tuesday and night, and Wednesday and night pl out through the triptych. Repetition is used to create a trippy sense of losing coherence- sometimes there's 3 Aro doing the same thing. It could be consecutive days or he' forgotten. At key moments it resolves to one image and then back aga Things seem to loop and his close-ups almost seem to watc the loops happening again and again. This is particularly true inside the head bag at night. When his light is swit on it's bleached and monstrously overlit, like cruel HD c up - his disintegration is terrifying. When it's off we establish a night vision, of green, of b that allows us to witness him in hiding. The images, sometimes of himself also, play out on the interior surfa of the bag. The effect is like wraparound Imax, multi-scr Technicolor. INT. CANYON. DAY. DIPTYCH. Aron has his headphones on EXT. STADIUM CROWD Listening to the live concert again. The laser in the CD The crowd smears, skips. dragged and distorted. It's been damaged by the time in The numbers skip on the the sand. display. As they stop...

Aron falls into the canyon. 58. Beyond the foot 11.32 => 11.33 in the sunlight Aron falls again into the HUGE figures. dagger. We don't canyon replayed in slower see above waist motion V.O: HERE he is height. Someone Aron lifts a carrying 2 huge huge rock onto office water his shoulder dispensers by and heaves it their necks walks to crash on into the canyon the chockstone He walks up to Aron It shatters And puts them down into dust. his side and leaves. It's like ARON: quarry mining. `Thanks' He finds a

My name is Aron Ralston. I was trapped by a boulder on Saturday and I've been without food and water for 5 days. I cut my arm off this morning to get free and I've lost a lot of blood. I need medical attention. There's a pause as they look at this refugee from a low budget horror movie. He hungrily eyes the water bottles attached to their waist bands. This gives them a way in t his world. The moment is broken by their offering him the water. It pours down his throat bypassing the swallow mechanism. CUT TO:

location: TV STUDIO. DAY. ERIK MEJER TESTIMONY

text: (Erik's English is almost perfect, although accented and without humour. His family sit beside him on comfortable chairs in a TV studio. They are very pleased to BE THERE) ERIK

We are the Mejers from Holland. At the start of the trailhead we talked to a ranger who told us about a car that was parked in the area already for several days and that the owner might be missing in the canyon. We joked that we would keep our eyes open and that we would try to find him. After a hike of 5.3 kilometres to the Great Gallery (Indian rock art) where we took some pictures, we returned and suddenly heard a noise behind us, and after that a voice that cried "Help, I need help". Monique and I immediately realized that this had to be the missing person. (MORE)
ERIK (CONT'D)
We didn't find him, he found us! We gave him our water and Oreos. CUT TO:
Back now live as Aron wolfs down the cookies and organise the Mejers in a series of jump cuts pushing us through th final stages-he's brutally practical. ERIK
We are the Mejers from Holland. You should stop and rest. ARON
No, we need to keep hiking. We need a helicopter - who can run fastest?- You, go now fast. Take him. Monique runs ahead with Andy, her son. ERIK
They told us you were here. ARON
Who? Who told you? ERIK
The police at the parking lot ARON
Do you have a phone? ERIK
There's no signal for miles. Nobody for 6 days and then like London buses another coup appears. They too are confronted by: ARON
Do you have a cell phone? WAYNE
No. I'm Wayne. I have some medical training. ARON
Is it ok for me to drink so much water? 74. WAYNE
Sure so long as it doesn't make you vomit. Aron drinks more and more, he overhears... WAYNE (CONT'D) (TO ERIK)
Make sure he doesn't pass out. ARON

I gotta stop and empty my shoes. You'll have to tie my shoe lace. As he sits his head slumps forward. He's absolutely motionless. Wayne and Erik try to talk to him but he can barely hear them. A pop song spins round and round distan He strains to pull his head up, and, staring, drops forwa to his knees. There it is. Filling his vision like a god. Whirling screaming in front of him, dust blasting him as kneels. A HELICOPTER. CUT TO:
A strange slightly formal man pops out of the helicopter. almost looks like he's part of the Matrix. PILOT
Are you Aron? ARON
Yes I am. Can I get a lift? CUT TO:
Aron looks at the beautiful white leather seat before he in the back of the helicopter. Surreal. It's a startling contrast to his Frankenstein, and even now it's not lost him. ARON
I'm gonna make a terrible mess of your seat. PILOT

Just get in buddy. We're all looking for you. The helicopter sucks upwards into the sky leaving Wayne, Monique, Andy and Erik far below. 75. _________________________________________________________ 1000 HOURS LATER CUT TO:

Underwater. A figure dives in, pulling strong breast stro down and towards us. Its Aron, fully recovered after surg Eyes open, he pulls and pulls down through crystal clear, oxygenated water. INTERCUT WITH:
As the helicopter and gurney staff transfer him into the medic room he's surrounded by vertical giants as he lies horizontal for the first time in 6 days. ARON
Thank you for bringing me back. The most senior of the burly men says, BURLY MAN
That's all your miracle days used up kid. You need to rest. You can stand everyone a beer later. Aron is greeted by medics. Needles. Care. Machines. Tubes ARON
Will you look after this for me please? He opens his fist and there is the small folded up knife. CUT TO:
He pulls again releasing a huge chunk of air into a metal bubble. CUT TO:
A very soft voice reading. VOICE (MOM)
...his love, the peace that passeth all understanding... ARON
Mom. MOM
My boy. My only one. There you are. She strokes his head so gently. ARON
Hey Mom. MOM
How are you feeling? ARON
OK. Are you okay... MOM
You've been asleep for 2 days. We are so lucky... She's a decent woman and a devoted mum. She looks weary, out with worry and love for her boy. ARON
Mom, I'm sorry I scared you. Very soft voice (again) - Aron hears the same words as he drifts back into drugged rest. VOICE (MOM)
...his love, the peace that passeth all understanding... CUT TO:

So are you guys ok with me? RANA
Yeah. We split up a while back when you were in hospital. ARON
Christine told me. RANA

I'm gonna finish the 49ers this winter or next. RANA

(over her glasses) Not Jesus please... ARON

No, he looked like my cousin Charlie but way too young... and I didn't know why but I knew he was mine and that this was what lay in front of me. He looks at her. Pause. She doesn't say anything. ARON (CONT'D)
But it's not going to be you, is it? RANA
No Aron, it's not. ARON (HE KNOWS)

You know, everyone who cares for you, a little bit of them dies each time you go back. Before he can work out how to answer she breaks the door open. 79. RANA (CONT'D)
Let's go hero. If they do The Fly first and we miss it we'll never be forgiven. EXT. CONCERT. NIGHT. The concert explode into life.
